A rising number, such as $ 34689$, is a positive integer each digit of which is larger than each of the digits to its left. There are $ \dbinom{9}{5} = 126$ five-digit rising numbers. When these numbers are arranged from smallest to largest, the $ 97$th number in the list does not contain the digit\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 4\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 5\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 6\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 7\qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ 8$
